p: To the best of our knowledge, this is the largest study investigating cardiac injury in hospitalized patients with influenza A (H7N9) viral infection. In this retrospective multicenter study, a high proportion (63.2%) of cardiac injury was found in hospitalized patients with influenza A (H7N9) viral infection. We found that cardiac injury was independently associated with increased risk of mortality during hospitalization among patients infected with H7N9 virus.
